root.title: CSS Concepts
root.content:
CSS Concepts

Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) is used to style and lay out web pages. Mastering its core concepts is key to creating beautiful and responsive designs.

selectors.title: Selectors
selectors.content:
Selectors

Selectors are patterns used to select the HTML element(s) you want to style. You can select elements by their tag name (e.g., p), class (e.g., .my-class), or ID (e.g., #my-id).

box-model.title: The Box Model
box-model.content:
The Box Model

Every HTML element can be considered a box. The CSS box model describes how this box is composed of: the content area, padding, border, and margin. Understanding this is fundamental to controlling layout and spacing.

flexbox-grid.title: Flexbox & Grid
flexbox-grid.content:
Flexbox & Grid

Modern CSS layout systems that replaced older, more difficult methods. Flexbox is designed for one-dimensional layouts (a row or a column). Grid is designed for two-dimensional layouts (rows and columns). Most modern layouts use a combination of both.

quiz.question: Which CSS layout model is best suited for arranging items in a single row with complex alignment?

responsive-design.title: Responsive Design
responsive-design.content:
Responsive Design

The practice of ensuring that web content looks good on all devices (desktops, tablets, and phones). This is primarily achieved using Media Queries, which apply different CSS rules based on the screen size or device characteristics.
